meanings.definition: A principle or set of principles laid down by an authority as incontrovertibly true.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's dogmata on honesty shaped our behavior in class.
meanings.sent2: The religious leader's dogmata guided the beliefs of the community.
meanings.sent3: Following the dogmata of always saying please and thank you made him the politest person in town.
meanings.sent4: She treated the rules of the road like dogmata, never breaking a single one.
meanings.sent5: The dogmata of kindness spread warmth and joy wherever it went.

meanings.definition: A doctrine or body of doctrines formally and authoritatively affirmed.
meanings.sent1: The political party's dogmata outlined their core beliefs.
meanings.sent2: The university's dogmata shaped the curriculum for all students.
meanings.sent3: The dogmata of always wearing matching socks became a fashion statement.
meanings.sent4: He held onto the dogmata of hard work like a lifeline in tough times.
meanings.sent5: The dogmata of teamwork helped the group achieve great success.
